intro: Hibbertia velutina, commonly known as the velvet-leafed hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with red stamens. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in regions of New South Wales and Queensland. Hibbertia velutina has narrow, hairy leaves that give it its common name, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. It is often grown in gardens for its ornamental value and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions.
